official-title.#text: Expressing the sense of Congress that Taiwan and its 23,000,000 people deserve membership in the United Nations.

Whereas for more than 50 years a close relationship has existed between the United States and Taiwan, which has been of major economic, cultural, and strategic advantage to both countries;
Whereas the 23,000,000 people in Taiwan are not represented in the
Whereas Taiwan has over the years repeatedly expressed its strong desire to participate in the
Whereas Taiwan has much to contribute to the work and funding of the

text.#text: Whereas the world community has reacted positively to Taiwan's desire for international participation, as shown by Taiwan's membership in the

quote.#text: Nothing in this Act may be construed as a basis for supporting the exclusion or expulsion of Taiwan from continued membership in any international financial institution or any other international organization.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 4(d) of the Taiwan Relations Act
